intro: Phanera guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese phanera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are usually large, heart-shaped, and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Phanera guianensis is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
